In May and June we were hopeful that we would be able to present our end of year slide shows and awards this fall. As the summer has continued, we realize now that it will be very unlikely that we can gather as a large group for many more months. We think it is important to send our students off to their Freshman year with special recognitions from all of us. So, we have decided to present the Eighth Grade Awards for 2019 – 2020 via a slide show. Trophies and certificates as appropriate to come this fall. There are three other videos that are very special including the staff farewell, the traditional growing up video, and highlights from this school year and past years. Those links will be sent to families. We would like to thank Mrs. Boyle and Mrs. Young for the great effort in putting the videos together!
We wish each new Freshman great success as you begin this new adventure in your learning. We hope that you will realize the strength and perseverance that you developed at Chatfield will make you a great, impactful, positive leader.

UPDATED INFORMATION:
Chatfield School is part of the collaborative free food program in Lapeer. The goal is to provide food to children in a non-congregate setting for the next several weeks. This free food program is available to all children under 18 years old and those with special needs under 26.

This service will begin Monday, March 16, 2020 and will be available Monday through Friday through April 3, 2020 at the LCS Center for Innovation (formerly Lapeer West High School) at 170 Millville Road in Lapeer.

Breakfast and lunch can be picked up together between 10 am. and 1 p.m. each day. Friday’s bag will include breakfast and lunch for the weekend as well.

Children do not need to be present for a parent to pick up their meals and do not need to be enrolled in Lapeer or any specific school district.

Menus will have assorted choices and will include fruit, vegetable and milk.
Any questions please call Joanne VanHouten, Director of Dining (810) 538-1649.
